bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from [Laura Armistead Carter] to Wade Hampton Frost, August 26, 1930

div1.p: [Carter] wonders if she has sent Frost a carbon copy of a letter from Henry Rose Carter to Guiteras and encloses a list of acknowledgments for the History of Yellow Fever.

div1.head: Letter from [Laura Armistead Carter] to Wade Hampton Frost, August 26, 1930
div1.opener:
Book, Misel
Preface, (Material for
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
August 26, 1930.
Dr. Wade H. Frost,
4710 Keswick Road,
Roland Park,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Dear Jack:
div1.p:
1: Have I, by any chance, already sent you a carbon copy of a letter
written by Father to Guiteras (in 1924 or 1925, I think) outlining his
tentative plans for a continuation of the work, after the cojmpletion
of Section iii, parts i and ii? I had the carbon this spring and put
it in an envelope, in order to send it to you when you were ready for it.
Found the envelope yesterday, where I had put it, but empty. I am en-
closing self-addressed envelope for data re above, also card, which will
save your having to write a letter (just cross out one or two words, as
the case may be), and I'll know whether I should look further.)

Miss Brown sorry to have held this up, but I doubt if you are quite ready for
it yet anyway. Also you had the dates (re Father's time of beginning the
work) in my letter of August 24, 1930.
With love to Susan and deepest appreciation to you both,

closer.seg:
Enclosures. enclosure 1 enclosure 2
P. S. Made a Memorandum of the contents of the above-mentioned
letter, before leaving Baltimore in 1927, and left it for you with the
rest of the material (MS etc.) for the book. Doubt, however, if you
still have it, as that was long ago and papers are certainly more mobile
than, chemically speaking, they have any right to be!
Sorry to have to send you such poorly typed material. My
machine, like myself, is old and the worse for wear. I shall have it
overhauled as soon as Miss Brown and I move, after which I trust it
will once more space correctly and turn out generally better work.
